txt.en: 'Hale my hand, now to his arm,\nlost too, lost too.'

'Long did I rest, now awake,
as vengeance claims trinkets
to call a curse upon our bones.

'As it was in life,
so too in death.
His curse on us still
as we yearn for sleep.

'My ring, forgotten,
may still be found.
Speed along, living,
to a tomb of ground.'
A Ring Wandered Away
The earth here was recently disturbed

'Long did I rest, now awake,
as vengeance claims trinkets
to call a curse upon our bones.

'As it was in life,
so too in death.
His curse on us still
as we yearn for sleep.

'My ring, forgotten,
may still be found.
Speed along, living,
to a tomb of ground.'
The earth appears undisturbed, head south.
The earth here is undisturbed, perhaps south-west.
Cryptic as it may be, it appears the shade is looking for something. Perhaps you can search the many barrows throughout the north Barrow-downs for clues.
The earth here is undisturbed, perhaps south-west.

The Wandering Shade's barrow is in the northern Barrow-downs.\n\nYour investigation lead you to a barrow where the earth was recently disturbed by the movement of the heavy, stone door to the grave within the mound. You should search the barrow, for signs that link the shade to this location.
The earth here is undisturbed, perhaps north-west.
The Wandering Shade roams the northern Barrow-downs.\n\nYou have found the Wandering Shade's ring and should now return it to its owner.
The earth here is undisturbed, perhaps west.
The earth here is undisturbed, perhaps north.
The earth here is undisturbed, perhaps north-west.
The earth here is undisturbed, perhaps north.
Seek the Wandering Shade's barrow
Move the slab before the Shade's tomb and defeat the wight within to obtain the Shade's ring.\n([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Deliver the ring to the Wandering Shade in the Barrow-downs
Deliver the ring to the Wandering Shade in the Barrow-downs
Deliver the ring to the Wandering Shade in the Barrow-downs
The earth here is undisturbed, perhaps south-west.
The earth here is undisturbed, perhaps north.
You have obtained the Shade's ring
A shade found wandering in the Barrow-downs -- meaning no ill, it seems -- felt the pull of its brother and struggles to appease whatever force has returned to awaken them.
Aqcuired Wandering Shade's Ring ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'All was silence;
now the sound of steel
rings from battles past
long beyond the laying of bones;
stirred by evil's passage
my brother walks again,
so too our foes.

'Duty-bound we stand as one,
lost as he may be.
A lord he rose and, solemn,
buried me.

'My shield calls to my arm,
my ring calls to my hand,
my sight departed as my life,
our oaths bind us still;
protect and serve this land.'
